sample_evaluations.notes: Minimal errors. 'ariyone' should be 'anyone' - appears to be a missed correction in the cleaning process. Overall excellent quality with proper formatting and accent correction (béautiful→beautiful).
Perfect clean text with no remaining OCR errors. All text is properly formatted and readable.

Severely degraded text with extensive OCR errors. Major issues include: 't°' (to), 'Ings', 'PD; ivorce y'', 'Tt', 'jee', 'Jast', 'Ts that', 'ome day', '2 meal', '2Ppapa', 'Joved', 'papaVil', 'Lesl'e', '10' (no), 'T wish', 'pack', 'purst', 'lve', 'js'. This appears to be from vol 9 but filename says 1822 (year error). The cleaning process failed significantly on this sample.
Perfect clean text with no remaining OCR errors. Proper nouns (Karl Rochell, Sister White, President Young, Isaiah) are correctly preserved.
Perfect clean text with no remaining OCR errors. Text is well-formatted with proper quotation marks and punctuation.
Minor errors found: 'egys' should be 'eggs', 'land' should be 'and'. Both are meaningful errors that affect comprehension. Clean text is otherwise well-formatted and readable.

batch_summary.overall_assessment: Batch shows highly inconsistent cleaning results. 3 samples are perfect (IDs 8, 10, 11), 2 are excellent (IDs 7, 12), but sample ID 9 failed dramatically with 29 remaining errors. The cleaning process appears to have worked well on most samples but completely failed on one specific document. Recommend investigating the failure case (ID 9 from March 1822 file) to identify what caused the degradation.
